cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.SY, cs.DS, cs.NE 

Reasoning: The paper deals with reinforcement learning algorithms for solving optimal stopping problems in Markov chains, which is a topic that falls under the broad category of machine learning. Specifically, the paper proposes a new algorithm called Zap-Q-learning, which is designed to converge faster than existing algorithms. This suggests that the paper is likely to be classified under the sub-category of machine learning (cs.LG) or artificial intelligence (cs.AI). Additionally, the paper involves the analysis of ODEs, which suggests that it may also be relevant to the sub-category of systems and control (cs.SY). The paper also deals with optimization problems, which could place it under the sub-categories of data structures and algorithms (cs.DS) or neural and evolutionary computing (cs.NE).
